content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.76 - Executive Order No. 76: Further Extending the Period for Paying Real Property Taxes Without Interest in Franklin County due to a Disaster Emergency. [*]
State Regulations
WHEREAS, beginning on January 7, 1998, a severe storm
system with a combination of rain, freezing rain, and ice caused widespread
power outages and disrupted vital transportation and public safety systems in
the counties and the contiguous areas of Clinton, Essex, Franklin, Jefferson, St. Lawrence and Lewis; WHEREAS, this event resulted in personal hardship and
damage to residential and commercial property, and it continues to pose a
threat to the public health and safety; WHEREAS, by Executive Order Number 60.1 I declared a State

Disaster Emergency in the affected counties, and directed State agencies to
respond as necessary to assist those affected counties in restoring vital
public transportation systems and to provide such other assistance as necessary
to protect the public health and safety; WHEREAS, real property taxes for the 1998 fiscal year are
currently due in the affected counties; WHEREAS, by virtue of section
924
of
the Real Property Tax Law, the date by which such taxes would have been payable
without interest was January 31, 1998; WHEREAS, January 31, 1998 being a Saturday, by virtue of
section
925-a
(1)
of the Real Property Tax Law, the period
for paying such taxes without interest was automatically extended until the
next business day, February 2, 1998; WHEREAS, such taxes would normally be subject to interest
if paid after that date; WHEREAS, section
925-a
(2)
of the Real Property Tax Law, as added by

Chapter 389 of the Laws of 1997, authorizes the Governor to issue an Executive

Order during a State Disaster Emergency, extending the period for paying real
property taxes without interest by up to seven days in a county, city, town, village or school district in the affected area, if the Chief Executive Officer
of the county, city, town, village or school district requests such an
extension; WHEREAS, Franklin County requested such an
extension; WHEREAS, given the hardships facing the people of Franklin

County as a result of the ice storm, such an extension was warranted; WHEREAS, pursuant to section
925-a
(2)
of the Real Property Tax Law, by

Executive Order Number 64 I extended by seven days the period for paying
without interest the real property taxes that are currently due in Franklin

County, so that such taxes could be paid without interest through February 9, 1998; WHEREAS, Franklin County requested a further extension
pursuant to section
925-a
(2)
of the Real Property Tax Law; WHEREAS, the residents of Franklin County continued to face
personal hardship as a result of the storm; WHEREAS, pursuant to section
925-a
(2)
of the Real Property Tax Law, by

Executive Order Number 70 I extended by seven days the period for paying
without interest the real property taxes that are currently due in Franklin

County, so that such taxes could be payable without interest through February
16, 1998; WHEREAS, February 16, 1998 being a public holiday, by
virtue of section
925-a
(1)
of the Real Property Tax Law, the period
for paying such taxes without interest was automatically extended until the
next business day, which was February 17, 1998; WHEREAS, Chapter 15 of the Laws of 1998 authorizes the

Governor to issue an Executive Order during a State Disaster Emergency, extending the deadlines for the payment of real property taxes, and the filing
of applications, reports or other documents, forms or other papers necessary
for the processing of an application or other process to fulfill requirements
to qualify for, or meet a condition of a government assistance program for
persons, businesses or corporations, higher education loans, grants or
financial assistance, licenses, registrations or other programs administered by
a municipal or district corporation in the affected area, if the Chief

Executive Officer of the municipality or district corporation requests such an
extension; WHEREAS, pursuant to Chapter 15 of the Laws of 1998, Franklin County has requested that I further extend the deadline for payment of
real property taxes in such county; and
WHEREAS, the residents of Franklin County continue to face
personal hardship as a result of the storm; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, pursuant to Chapter 15 of the Laws of 1998, do hereby extend the
deadline for payment without interest of real property taxes that are currently
due to Franklin County and all municipal or district corporations located
therein, throughout the period that the State Disaster Emergency declared by

Executive Order No. 60.1 is in effect, and such extension shall be deemed to
have been in effect since February 17, 1998. Signed: George E. Pataki

Dated: February 19, 1998
